title: Stacked Imbalance
content:
This indicator is designed to identify and visualize imbalances between supply and demand volumes at adjacent price levels. It provides insight into potential areas of interest for traders based on differences in volume. The magnitude of the imbalance is determined as a percentage of the compared volumes. For example, let's analyze the value of 30 ask and the value of the overweight of 350%, 350% of 30 = 105, in order for the cluster to be highlighted, the bid must be more than 105.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Settings

NameDescription
Ignore zero values If enabled, zero values are not included in the calculations.
Imbalance Ratio Defines the minimum value of the ratio.
Imbalance Range Defines the minimum number of levels in a given range.
Imbalance Volume Volumes that are less than the value set in this filter will be ignored.

Calculation

NameDescription
Days look back Refers to the number of previous days taken into account when calculating an indicator.

Drawing

NameDescription
Line till touch Determines whether to extend the line until it touches the bar.
Ask/Bid Imbalance Color Sets the color for elements with a bullish direction.
Bid/Ask Imbalance Color Sets the color for elements with a bearish direction.
Line width Determines the width of the displayed line.
Print line for X bars Determines the length of the displayed line.

Alerts

NameDescription
Signal alert Determines whether to issue an alert when a specified signal appears.
Approximation alert Determines whether an alert is issued when the price approaches a certain level.
Alert File This parameter allows users to specify the name of a custom audio file for alert sounds. Users can select a WAV file that will be played whenever an alert condition is triggered. The chosen WAV file should be located in the folder C:\Program Files (x86)\ATAS Platform\Sounds.
